definition[0]: to hold something tightly because you do not want to lose it
example[0]: She was clutching a bottle of champagne.
definition[1]: to suddenly take hold of someone or something because you are frightened, in pain, or in danger
example[1]: He clutched at a pillar for support.
example[2]: Tom fell to the ground clutching his stomach.
definition[2]: if something clutches at your heart, you suddenly feel fear or nervousness
definition[3]: the pedal that you press with your foot when driving a vehicle in order to change gear, or the part of the vehicle that this controls
definition[4]: a tight hold that someone has on something
example[3]: I shook myself free of her clutch.
